summaryText: Pastor Travis Hearn delivers a powerful message about life-changing encounters with Christ! In this transformative sermon, PT breaks down three critical components of genuine spiritual transformation. First, he emphasizes that true change begins with a genuine encounter with Jesus - not just knowing about Him, but experiencing a radical, personal moment of surrender. Using the incredible story of Paul's conversion, Pastor Travis reveals how God actively pursues us, even in our darkest moments. Can you imagine going from persecuting Christians to becoming the most influential apostle? That's the power of a true encounter with Christ! The sermon powerfully illustrates that God is constantly chasing us, sending signs, people, and sometimes even challenging circumstances to draw us closer to Him. Pastor Travis shares his own testimony of transformation, demonstrating how God can completely revolutionize a life in an instant. The message is a beautiful reminder that no one is too far gone, and God's love can reach anyone, anywhere, at any time. The key takeaway? God specializes in bringing dead things back to life, and He wants to do that in your life right now!
mainPoints: A true encounter with Christ changes everything
When God encounters you, you will never be the same again
Sanctification is a continual process of becoming more like Christ

versesMentioned.text: Meanwhile Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord's disciples. He went to the high priest and asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any there who belonged to the Way, whether men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem. As he neared Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him. He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, 'Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?' 'Who are you, Lord?' Saul asked. 'I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,' he replied.

Then Jesus told them this parable: 'Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Doesn't he leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it? And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says, 'Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.'''
Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit dwells in your midst?
May God himself, the God of peace, sanctify you through and through. May your whole spirit, soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes: first to the Jew, then to the Gentile.
He must become greater; I must become less.

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.action: Take time to reflect on areas of your life where you need transformation. Write down specific areas where you want God to work and create change.
Monday.prayer: Lord, I invite Your transformative power into every area of my life. Show me where I need to surrender and allow You to work. Help me embrace the new creation You're making me to be. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding God's ongoing work in our lives
Tuesday.action: Journal about a specific area where you've seen God working in your life. Identify one habit or thought pattern you want God to continue transforming.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust in Your process of sanctification. Continue Your work in me, refining me and making me more like Jesus. Give me patience and humility in this journey. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:22-24: 'You were taught, with regard to your former way of life, to put off your old self, which is being corrupted by its deceitful desires; to be made new in the attitude of your minds; and to put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one specific behavior or thought pattern from your 'old self' that you want to replace with a Christ-like alternative. Create a practical strategy for this transformation.
Wednesday.prayer: God, help me actively participate in my own spiritual growth. Give me wisdom to recognize areas that need change and courage to pursue transformation. Renew my mind and spirit. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.'
Thursday.focus: Resisting worldly patterns and embracing God's perspective
Thursday.action: Audit your media consumption, social interactions, and daily choices. Identify areas where you might be unconsciously conforming to worldly patterns.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal any areas where I'm conforming to the world's standards instead of Your divine perspective. Give me discernment and strength to choose Your way. Renew my mind daily. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Galatians 2:20: 'I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.'
Friday.focus: Living from a place of complete surrender
Friday.action: Practice a day of intentional surrender. Before each major decision, pause and ask, 'What would Christ want in this moment?'
Friday.prayer: Jesus, I surrender my will to Yours. Help me decrease so that You might increase in every area of my life. Guide my thoughts, actions, and responses today. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 Peter 1:15-16: 'But just as he who called you is holy, so be holy in all you do; for it is written: 'Be holy, because I am holy.''
Saturday.action: Create a personal 'holiness inventory'. Reflect on areas of your life where you want to grow in Christ-likeness. Share this with a trusted friend or mentor for accountability.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, set me apart for Your purposes. Reveal areas where I need to grow in holiness. Give me a heart that desires to reflect Your character in every aspect of my life. Amen.
